description.narrative: Create favorable business climate and conditions for private sector investment in low-carbon and other environmentally-friendly businesses in Montenegro
seat of a first-order administrative division

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: 1. tCO2eq direct emissions reductions (attributable to the project-facilitated green investments made during the project’s supervised implementation period, totaled over the respective lifetime of the investments) 2. Number of project beneficiaries, including % of women 3. Volume of additional public and private investment mobilized for low GHG development 4. Number of decision makers in the Ministry of Tourism and Sustainable Development that understand and recognize policy and incentive options for green businesses in agricultural, tourism and energy sectors 5. Level of capitalization of the Eco-Fund 6. Number of existing and potential entrepreneurs trained and assisted through the Green Business Incubator (green business services delivered) 7. Number of IDF staff, and other relevant institutions, trained to implement and market IDF’s green business financing 8. Number of green business investments supported via performance-based payment 9. Number of direct green business stakeholders (existing and potential entrepreneurs and technical specialist) reached out to by awareness raising activities

comment.narrative: 1. Study and roadmap for policy and incentive options for green businesses in agricultural, tourism and energy sectors 2. Eco-Fund’s regulatory provisions developed, and advisory services provided to diversify its funding base 3. Work on strenthening capacities of Green Business Center Cetinje 4. Entrepreneurs supported through the Green Business Incubator (50 existing and potential, including at least 20% women) 5. Training workshops to develop green business skills delivered (3 workshops training a total of 50 specialists, including at least 20% women). 6. Capacities created within IDF to implement/enhance green business financing 7. Financing mechanism (performance-based payment scheme) designed and implemented 8. Awareness-raising activities conducted (150 existing and potential entrepreneurs and 100 stakeholders from public institutions, industry experts and academia) 9. Green Business Incubator communication tools developed (reaching out to 300 entrepreneurs) 10. Additional activities

1. the “Study on policies and incentives for green business in Montenegro with a focus on agriculture, energy and tourism, with a roadmap for future climate action in these areas was developed with the goal to help the Government to design or reform economic instruments related to environmentally harmful projects in order to provide incentives for both reducing pollution and introducing greener products.Up to date, despite the limitations imposed by COVID 19 context for proper presentation and dissemination of the document, the document was very positively evaluated by stakeholders involved in the preparation process. In addition, the document was used as an input for preparation of: - Design of the performance-based payment scheme (PBPS) for Investment Development Fund of Montenegro, - Design of the performance-based payment scheme (PBPS) for Eco Fund of Montenegro, - Input for preparation of Assessment of the impact of COVID 19 on the business sector and the growth prospects of the Montenegrin economy, - Input for preparation of the UN Socio-economic response plan to COVID-19 in Montenegro, - Input for discussion between Investment development Fund and European Investment Banka and Investment development Fund and Agence Francaises De Developpement. 2. - Rulebook on the implementation of the procedure for evaluation of applications under the public competition and the manner of monitoring the intended use of funds for the environmental protection fund. The document served as input for future development of 3 Eco Fund Rule books, - Cooperation agreement signed between UNDP and Eco Fund. The agreement will serve as a framework for future cooperation focusing on creation of capacity building program for employees in the Eco Fund, Investment Development fund, Chamber of commerce, SMEs and line ministries. As the institution mandated with financing projects and processes relevant for green development the project initiated the design of capacity building program with Eco Fund in the central role in order to secure improvement of capacities and green business skills, - Environmental Protection Fund of Montenegro: Design and implementation of the performance-based payment scheme (PBPS), - Inputs for preparation of Funds financial and work plans. During the project implementation UNDP team identified, made contacts and facilitated communication with the team from Slovenian Ministry of the Environment and Spatial Planning. The goal of this interaction was to position Eco Fund as beneficiary of Slovenian climate fund resources. The Project managed to use processes and cooperation with Eco Fund to present a case to the Government of Slovenia and urge for support to the Fund in Montenegro in a form of technical support and financial support for implementation of grant scheme. While negotiation is in the progress Slovenian experts proposed to the Slovenian Government to allocate 1.3 million euros for this purpose. The funds, if agreed, should provide technical assistance and funds for granting. 3. - Eco Business Center (EBC) strategic and action plan developed. Taking in consideration COVID-19 effects on MNE economy the UNDP and Cetinje team is initiating revision and update of the plan; - Criteria for use of space and services of Eco Business Center developed and adopted; - Mentoring program needs assessment resulting in creation of mentoring program focusing on: • Legislative Regulation, Accounting and Administrative Conditions • Strategic and Financial Planning • Innovation, ICT and New Technologies • Product Development and promotion - Memorandum of cooperation signed with Old Royal Capital Cetinje, - Supported design of grant/subsidies program to be implanted by Old Royal Cetinje/Centre with additional focus on green jobs. 4. Based on Mentoring Programme Needs assessment, terms of references for mentors where developed and services of the 5 mentors procured. Within the advisory and mentoring support, which represents the possibility and opportunity to use other types of support, a mentoring program is envisaged in 4 areas: - Legislation, accounting and administrative framework - Strategic and financial planning, management and networking in business - Product development, promotion, marketing and networking - Innovations and new technologies. Starting from November 2019 up to date the continuous call for applicants was advertised and continuously promoted offering advice to more than 120 users up to date 5.Activities postponed for 2021. result of changes in the basic project conditions, while the project purpose remains unchanged resulted in request for project extension until November 2021: - The COVID-19 lockdown in the country caused economic withdrawal and private-sector focus on maintaining liquidity, thus halting planned investments aligned with the project’s purpose. - The elections in August additionally affected the implementation as, historically, the pre-election period results in decreased partner activities. The result is a new parliamentary majority, for the first time in 30 years, resulting in the ongoing formation of the government. - The project support for some of the key partners was delayed. Namely, the Business Centre in Cetinje appointed its director and management structure only in November 2019, while the Eco Fund (EF) become operational in the first half of 2020. As the EF should one of become key facilitators of the green transition, adjusting the project’s capacity-building activities to include the EF team should be considered a priority. 6. Same as per 5. 7. Same as per 5 and 6. 8. and 9. The rising awareness approach of the project was three-fold: - reach out and have as many one on one discussions with potential beneficiaries; - use concrete activities and tangible results as information dissemination platform; - building on these inputs create long term platform and information sharing hub regarding green development. While the set for the first two points is well undergoing the third set of activities implementation is in development phase. The outreach towards potential beneficiaries of mentoring services was done through public calls, individual reaching out of mentors, BCC and project teams and use of available data bases and contacts. The result is that more users of mentoring services is outside of Cetinje, from Bar, Mojkovac and Budva municipality contacted the project for mentoring services and agreement was made for providing services for ongoing national Employment institute grant program; Promotion of the Green Economy concept, raising awareness and increasing knowledge of sustainable development in national and regional context, based on international best practices through supporting UNDP and Government organized International Conference Green Days: Unlocking Green Growth Potential in 2019 and 2020; For the purpose of increasing the EBC visibility and outreach two workshops on using social media where organised as weel as development of: - EBC communication strategy - EBC brand and branding - EBC social media posting framework. 10. approval of proposal City Experiment. The project, in cooperation with UNDP project team used funds from Istanbul regional hub and Svovak Government. The proposal is approved and will aim for: - multi-stakeholder consensus on the fundamental transformation of Pljevlja towards a healthy, resilient and prosperous city through processes of mapping and better understanding of the needs of citizens and business community by co-designing systems and support mechanisms. Two-fold goals resonate with recurrent calls for broader conceptualization of new development paths: New development agenda based on multi-actor approach that directs due attention to technological innovation, facilitation of R&D and the investments in human capital ensuring competitiveness and progress, and through it a sustainable local economic growth in order to capture inwards and outward flows of capital and knowledge. Integrated solutions with focus on decarbonization programs that will further accelerate investments and boost up transformation

1. Training workshops to develop green business skills delivered (3 workshops training a total of 50 specialists, including at least 20% women). 2. Capacities created within IDF and Eco Fund to implement/enhance green business financing 3. Financing mechanism (performance-based payment scheme) designed and implemented

Number of entrepreneurs trained and assisted through the Green Business Incubator (green business services delivered) -247 (22% women). IDF and Eco Fund successfully implemented the Incentive Progrsmme for Green businesses, Through the Subsidy Programme supporting the installation of solar PV systems, the Eco Fund introduced performance-based payment scheme that so far assisted five prosumers in the field of agriculture, energy, furniture production and catering Green credit line launched by the Investment Development Fund offering favorable conditions to micro, small and medium enterprises willing to shift to renewables – installation of solar PV systems

• Activities implemented in cooperation with Business Center Cetinje (BCC) resulted in preparation of Strategic development plan for BCC with action plan that will lead process of transformation of the BCC toward more green development centre. • Mentoring program for SMEs is established in October and so far, 9 different business benefited from advisory services • Technical assistance was provided in developing guidelines on Integration of Small-Scale Renewable Installations. The focus of the work was on identifying existing legal and financial framework for installation of Small-Scale Solar Installations, identifying existing and potential gaps and based on this input develop recommendations and guidelines on Integration of Small-Scale Renewable Installations. The purpose of the assignment is to support the development of the decentralized solar energy market in Montenegro by de-risking investments and sourcing innovative technologies in local communities. The overall objective of the assignment is to improve the business conditions in the sector of decentralized renewable energy sources (renewables) by means of development of innovative business models for production and use of solar energy, to create market for and facilitate the wider use of solar energy in Montenegro. Resulting document titled “Energy exchange opportunities at the point of connection in Montenegro, current situation and recommendations for improvements” develops set of recommendations in thematic area. • CO team supported countries obligations toward Man and the Biosphere (MAB) Programme and its World Network of Biosphere Reserves, MAB Strategy (2015-2025), Lima Action Plan (2016-2025) and Lima Declaration within the context of Tara MAB Reserve. The conclusions from Thirty-first session in UNESCO Paris Headquarters, 17 – 21 June 2019 stated that the Advisory Committee concluded that the site meets the criteria of the Statutory Framework of the World Network of Biosphere Reserves. • In addition, relying on UNDP internal capacities and expertise, CO supported the Country in proclamation of additional protected area in Montenegro: Park of Nature Komovi for Kolasin Municipality territory and will support preparation of management plan reflecting need ad guidance for sustainable use and green jobs development.
Additional resource mobilisation: Slovak Fund: A comprehensive Energy Audit, Business and Financial Model for modernization of the public lighting system of Podgorica City was prepared and presented to the municipal officials and representative of the public utility company. The same activity is taking place in Kolasin, Cetinje, Budva and Danilovgrad with the purpose to reduce energy costs and CO2 emission for up to 70%. Slovak Fund: Preparation of 4 main projects for photovoltaic (solar) installations. UNDP core funds: Technical assistance was provided in developing guidelines on “Identification of green added value products and feasibility assessment of related value chains”. Aim of this assignment is to identify concrete green products with high market value and job creation potential, identify possibilities for greening products for these products and implementation possibilities of the identified solutions. The results will feed in the implementation of support to new and existing businesses.
